The Four Seasons (Italian: Le quattro stagioni) is a group of four violin concerti by 
Italian composer Antonio Vivaldi, each of which gives a musical expression to a 
season of the year. They were written about 1723 and were published in 1725 in 
Amsterdam, ... Concerto No. 1 in E major, Op. 8, RV 269, "La primavera" (Spring).
